discovery_instructions: Identify what the main item/entity is for this feature (e.g., employee record, document, invitation)
Look for list/table views - the rows represent the primary entity
Check page headers and breadcrumbs for entity naming
Note the singular and plural forms used in the UI

find_trigger: Look for buttons with: + Add, + Create, + New, plus icon
Check top-right corner of the page
Look in empty state messages for create prompts
create.validation: New item appears in list with unique identifier

find_trigger: Click on any row in a list/table
Look for 'View' or eye icon buttons
Check if rows are clickable (cursor changes)
read.validation: Detail panel, modal, or page opens showing full information

find_trigger: Look for Edit button, pencil icon
Check for inline editing (click on field to edit)
Look for status change dropdowns or buttons
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for edit option
update.validation: Changes persist after save, reflected in list view

find_trigger: Look for Delete button, trash icon
Check action menus (three-dot menu) for delete option
Look for bulk delete with checkboxes
Some features use 'Archive' or 'Cancel' instead of delete
delete.validation: Item removed from list or status changed to deleted/archived

Document any modals, dialogs, slide-out panels

Look for filters, search, sort, and export options
Check for bulk action controls (checkboxes, select all)
Note any settings or configuration options

content_clusters.topic: Employee Profile Data & Bulk Upload Limitations
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Grouped tickets affecting employee profile creation, editing, and data validation. Includes hire date validation timing, save button failures, avatar upload performance, work location restrictions, and job title field limitations.
Grouped tickets affecting end of service workflows. Includes EOS calculation date restrictions and gratuity field editing constraints during offboarding.
Grouped tickets affecting reporting capabilities. Includes missing advanced filter logic (AND operations) and lack of custom field support in AI Reports.
Grouped tickets affecting UI/UX across employee profile and related modules. Includes redundant dropzone areas, responsive design constraints, and unnecessary API authorization checks.
Grouped tickets representing missing or incomplete features. Includes location constraints, policy view functionality, delete action placement, and automated profile completion reminders.
Grouped tickets affecting data consistency and lookup capabilities. Includes missing IBAN verification tools.

Grouped tickets addressing document lifecycle management, expiry notifications, document relationships, and editing restrictions. Merged PHP-to-Kotlin migration tickets (AV-1416, AV-1433) as they represent the same underlying limitation in notification system architecture.

Grouped tickets addressing EOS calculation gaps, inability to reopen/reverse settlements, and lack of leave balance adjustment capabilities. All represent limitations in financial settlement workflows.
Grouped tickets addressing insufficient validation during Excel uploads and unclear error messaging for file constraints. Both impact data quality during bulk entry operations.
Grouped tickets addressing leave record visibility after policy unassignment and inappropriate employee mentions in comments. Both affect leave request workflow consistency.
Grouped tickets addressing loading state inconsistencies, translation rendering issues in Ember framework, and document import paging problems. Marked as obsolete/Won't Do due to React migration.
Single ticket addressing lack of advanced document sectioning by entity in Knowledge Hub.
Single ticket addressing work email change restrictions for registered users.

product_context.title: PRD: Employee Documents
product_context.why_built: Enable HR administrators to manage complete employee document lifecycle from pre-hire through exit. Automate compliance tracking with expiry notifications so managers can proactively initiate document renewals. Meet regulatory and legal requirements for document management across UAE and international operations.
key_design_decisions: Expiry reminders configurable from 1-12 months before expiry (default 7 months for key documents)
Special handling for 'Others' document type: expiry toggle locked to TRUE but expiry date entry not mandatory
Support for both old and new Emirates ID formats with same field structure
Multi-language support for document names (English and Arabic)
Default document types cannot be deleted but configurations can be edited
Automated email reminders sent to stakeholders before document expiry

detected_integrations.description: Office locations integrate with attendance system for location-based check-ins and employee assignment to specific offices with configurable radius validation.
EOS calculations and gratuity processing depend on payroll period closure status and validation rules. Payroll integrity constraints affect employee termination workflows.
Document expiry reminders and employee invitation notifications are sent via automated email system to relevant stakeholders.
Employee invitations, organizational structure visualization, and document management all integrate with employee profile system for data consistency.
Office locations, bank accounts, document types, and employee groups are all configured through Company Settings interface.
Employee group access control integrates with roles management to enforce payroll data visibility restrictions by admin role.
Wellness Hub connects to Google Fit for fitness data synchronization on Android devices.
Announcements, employee invitations, and organizational structure are accessible from Company menu for centralized employee management.
Leave page in employee profiles triggers unnecessary time-off configuration API calls, causing 403 authorization errors for users without time-off permissions.
Goals section in Performance Management module has responsive design constraints affecting employee profile table width and layout rendering.
Employee profile deletion affects associated document recovery and data restoration capabilities. Company documents lack expiry-based tracking integration.
AI Reports and payroll reporting modules lack support for custom employee data fields and advanced filtering logic, limiting data analysis capabilities.
Leave records visibility, balance adjustments, and policy management affect leave request workflows and employee leave data consistency.
Custom data fields at invoice and line-item levels support AP invoice detail customization (completed feature).
Document sectioning and organization capabilities affect knowledge management and company document repository structure.
Excel export functionality for team data and employee records impacts reporting and data analysis workflows.
Document expiry reminders and HR-related classes require migration from PHP to Kotlin for improved scalability and maintenance.

what_to_do.task: Create and manage multiple office locations

Expand Offices section
Click 'Add New' to create office location
Enter office name and location details

Save office location
Edit or delete existing office locations as needed
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Office locations are created and configured with attendance tracking parameters. Employees can be assigned to specific offices for location-based check-in management.
rules_and_constraints: Geo-location is automatically filled when creating an office
Attendance check-in is limited by configurable radius from office location
Multiple office locations can be created for a single company
edge_cases: Attendance radius can be adjusted to accommodate flexible work arrangements
Check-in radius affects employee attendance validation for remote or hybrid work scenarios

what_to_do.task: Configure document types with expiry tracking and reminders
steps: Navigate to Settings > Company > Employee or Company document types
View existing default and custom document types
Click 'Add New' to create custom document type
Enter document type name (2-70 characters) in English and optionally Arabic
Mark document as mandatory or non-mandatory
Configure expiry date tracking toggle
If expiry enabled: set email reminder frequency (1-12 months before expiry)
Save document type configuration
Edit existing custom document types as needed
System automatically sends expiry reminders to relevant stakeholders
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Document types are configured with mandatory status and expiry tracking. Automated email reminders are sent to HR and managers before document expiry, enabling proactive renewal and compliance management.
rules_and_constraints: Only users with specific administrative roles can manage document types
Default document types cannot be deleted, but their configurations can be edited
Document names support both English and Arabic languages
Expiry reminders are configurable from 1-12 months before expiry
Default reminder is 7 months before expiry for Passport, Residency Visa, and Emirates ID
Special handling for 'Others' document type: expiry toggle is locked to TRUE but expiry date entry is not mandatory
Emirates ID supports both old and new format variations with same field structure
edge_cases: Cannot delete default document types, but can modify their mandatory status (except 'Others' type)
Email reminders are mandatory when expiry tracking is enabled
Multi-language support requires document names in both English and Arabic for international compliance
Reminder timing default of 7 months may not suit all document types and can be customized
Document types are sorted using same logic as Company documents for consistency

source_articles.title: How to configure company or employee document types

steps: Navigate to Company > All Employees section

Invitation expires in 3 days
Email field is mandatory for sending invitations

what_to_do.task: Correct and resend invitations to wrong employee email
steps: Identify the incorrect employee invitation in pending invitations list
Delete the existing incorrect invite using dustbin icon
Navigate to employee's Personal tab in their profile
Edit Contact section to update work email address
Save the corrected email address
Navigate to All Employees tab
Click 'Send Invite' next to the employee name
Confirm invitation sent to correct email address
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Incorrect invitations are deleted and corrected invitations are sent to the right email address. Employee receives invitation at correct contact information.
rules_and_constraints: The invite can only be modified if the employee has not yet registered on Bayzat
If employee has already registered, work email field is greyed out and cannot be changed directly by administrator
If employee has registered, contact Customer Support via chat feature for email changes
edge_cases: If employee has already registered, administrator cannot directly change email and must contact support
Workflow requires deletion of incorrect invite before sending new one to prevent duplicate invitations

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Employee Profile Page Access Blocked by Hire Date Validation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Leave page in employee profiles enforces hire date validation at the page load stage, preventing users from accessing the entire page instead of allowing access with deferred validation for specific actions. This blocks HR admins and people managers from viewing or managing leave information when hire date validation fails.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Employee Profile Data Entry & Save Failures
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Employee Profile Work tab lacks robust input validation and save functionality. Users can enter partial or invalid data without clear guidance on required fields or valid formats, and the save button may fail to persist changes. Additionally, avatar upload experiences significant performance delays during image preview generation, and the system allows multiple concurrent save attempts without proper debouncing.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Work Location Dropdown Limited to Company Registration Country
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The work location field in employee profiles is restricted to display only locations from the company's registered country. A UAE-registered company cannot assign or manage employee work locations in other GCC countries, limiting multi-country workforce management capabilities.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: End of Service Calculation Date Restrictions
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform enforces a strict validation rule preventing EOS calculations for dates before the first day of the previous closed payroll period. This creates a rigid constraint that blocks backdated terminations and prevents HR admins from processing end-of-service requests for employees with retroactive termination dates.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Ensures payroll integrity by preventing EOS calculations that would conflict with closed payroll periods

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Gratuity Field Editing Blocked When Amount is Zero
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform prevents editing gratuity amount and comment fields when the gratuity amount is zero. This blocks HR admins and finance managers from making necessary modifications to gratuity records during the offboarding process, even when updates are required.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Incomplete Employee Data Recovery After Deletion
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has partial data recovery capabilities where employee profiles can be retrieved but not all associated employee data can be restored. This creates uncertainty and potential data loss risk for HR admins managing employee records, as some historical or linked data may be permanently lost.

The Bayzat platform lacks comprehensive Company Documents management capabilities. Users cannot track, organize, or manage company documents effectively. Additionally, the platform lacks automated document tracking and display functionality based on expiration dates, preventing users from sorting, filtering, or automatically managing documents according to their lifecycle.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Payroll Reporting Advanced Filtering & Custom Field Limitations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The payroll reporting module lacks advanced filtering capabilities that allow users to combine custom data filters using intersection (AND) logic. Additionally, AI Reports functionality does not support employee custom fields, preventing users from leveraging unique, user-defined employee data in AI-generated reports. Engineering has confirmed custom field support in AI Reports is technically challenging and not in the near-term roadmap.

The document expiry reminder system lacks granular notification preferences and flexible scheduling. Users can only receive monthly automated emails, and the system has architectural constraints with PHP implementation that limits scalability and maintenance. Document expiry reminders require migration to Kotlin for improved performance.

The document management system lacks automatic relationship maintenance when documents are replaced or edited, and does not provide nuanced editing controls for dependent documents across different document types. Users must manually re-establish document links after changes, and there is no mechanism to dynamically restrict modifications based on document type or policy stage.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Employee Profile Data Completeness & Bulk Upload Gaps
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The employee profile city dropdown for Saudi Arabia is incomplete, lacking several important regional cities. The bulk upload template does not support job type/employment type configuration, preventing users from assigning job categories via bulk upload. Additionally, role management through Excel exports/imports is restricted, limiting HR administrators' ability to manage complex employee role structures. Translation configuration issues may require manual intervention during company onboarding.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: End of Service Settlement & Leave Balance Management
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The EOS calculation framework is incomplete and requires manual intervention for service termination compensation calculations. The system cannot comprehensively handle complex entitlement rules and service period tracking. Users lack a self-service mechanism to reopen or reverse finalized EOS settlements and must rely on backend support for manual deletion and recalculation. Additionally, the leave management system lacks the capability to manually adjust leave balances, preventing HR from handling complex scenarios that require balance modifications or negative balance support.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Data Validation & Error Messaging in Bulk Uploads
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks comprehensive data validation checks during Excel uploads for payroll and employee records, allowing submission of incomplete data such as blank account numbers and MoL IDs without proper contextual validation. Additionally, the document upload system has a 5MB file size constraint, but error messaging does not clearly communicate this limit to users, lacking precision and user-friendly guidance.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Records Visibility & Employee Mention Controls
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks consistent data persistence and visibility for leave records when an employee is removed from a policy, creating an inconsistent user experience where leave records are handled differently across views. Additionally, the system allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in leave request and attendance comments, which creates potential confusion and inappropriate interaction scenarios.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Excel Export Failures in Team Reporting
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has a technical constraint preventing successful Excel file generation and download in the View Team Page, impacting users' ability to export and analyze team data efficiently.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Frontend UI/UX Issues in Legacy Ember Architecture
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Employee Documents dashboard widget lacks consistent loading state visual feedback, creating an inconsistent user experience where widget loading states are not standardized. The employee profile work tab has translation rendering issues in the Ember frontend framework. Document import paging has inconsistent handling of page states during file deletion, particularly when removing files from the last page.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: These issues are specific to the older Ember frontend architecture and became obsolete during the React migration.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Knowledge Hub platform lacks advanced document sectioning capabilities that would allow granular organization of company documents by entity, limiting users' ability to efficiently categorize and manage their document repositories.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Work Email Change Restrictions for Registered Users
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The current Bayzat platform allows work email changes for registered users, which could potentially compromise data consistency and user verification processes. This represents a system-level validation weakness in employee record management where email changes should be restricted once a user account is registered.

3. IDENTIFY ENTITY - Determine the primary item/entity using primary_entity discovery
4. CRUD TEST - Test create, read, update, delete for the primary entity
5. WORKFLOW CHECK - Verify if feature has workflow triggers/actions
6. WHAT_TO_DO - Execute each task from what_to_do array, validate expected outcomes
7. WHAT_TO_WATCH_OUT_FOR - Validate known limitations and edge cases
